NEW YORK, Oct. 14, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Visible Light Communication (VLC) is a subset of optical wireless communication technology, which uses Light Emitting Diodes (LEDs) for short range communication. The technology, also referred as Light Fidelity (Li-Fi) technology or 5th Generation (5G) technology, provides a combination of illumination and communication. VLC market in the United States is surging on account of increasing data traffic, and growing demand for faster and more energy-efficient solutions for data transmission. Major applications for VLC technology include indoor networking applications, location based applications, underwater communication, and Intelligent Transportation System (ITS), among others. Adoption of VLC in Internet of Things (IoT), Machine to Machine (M2M), and Wireless Sensor Network (WSM) applications is also increasing in the US, which is anticipated to further propel growth in the country's VLC market over the forecast period.According to "United States Visible Light Communication Market Forecast & Opportunities, 2020", visible light communication market in the United States is forecast to grow at a CAGR of over 20% during 2015 - 2020. Growth in the market is anticipated on account of growing awareness of VLC technology, rising number of connected devices, increasing data traffic across the United States, in consonance with escalating research & development activities and government support. Government and various research organizations in the country are investing heavily in improving the data range of VLC technology. Also, LVX System Corporation is working in collaboration with NASA to evolve VLC technology for ground as well as potential space-based applications. In view of these developments, United States Visible Light Communication market is forecast to witness significant growth over the next five years.
